Class GameWord

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameWord

  • public class GameWord
extends java.lang.Object
    The class GameWord creates objects and utilizes methods for the hangman game.
    Version:
    2/23/2019
    Author:
    Austin Lowery

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameWord()
      This no-args constructor sets all fields to their default value.
      GameWord(java.lang.String phraseToGuess)
      This constructor takes in the phrase to guess, sets the inProgress field to a string containing the same amount of underscores as the phrase does variables, and sets every other field to their default value.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkWin()
      This method returns true if all characters in the phrase has been guessed, otherwise, it returns false
      void find(char symbol)
      The method find is used to check if the character guessed is within the phrase.
      boolean getGameOver()
      The get method getGameOver returns whether or not the user has lost.
      java.lang.String getPhrase()
      This get method returns the phrase to the user.
      void setMoviePhrase(int year)
      This set method setMoviePhrase gets one of the top ten movies from wikipedia from a specific year and makes it the phrase for the hangman game.
      void setPhrase(java.lang.String phraseToGuess)
      The set method setPhrase creates a new phrase for the game updating each respective field.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method returns a string with a separator, the phrase that is in the progress of being deciphered, and the state of the hangman.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        public GameWord()
        This no-args constructor sets all fields to their default value.

      • GameWord

        public GameWord(java.lang.String phraseToGuess)
        This constructor takes in the phrase to guess, sets the inProgress field to a string containing the same amount of underscores as the phrase does variables, and sets every other field to their default value.
        Parameters:
        phraseToGuess - the phrase used in the game of hangman

    • Method Detail

      • checkWin

        public boolean checkWin()
        This method returns true if all characters in the phrase has been guessed, otherwise, it returns false
        Returns:
        match - the boolean value used to determine if the game has been won or not.

      • find

        public void find(char symbol)
        The method find is used to check if the character guessed is within the phrase.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol representing the guessed character within the phrase.

      • getGameOver

        public boolean getGameOver()
        The get method getGameOver returns whether or not the user has lost.
        Returns:
        gameOver - boolean storing whether or not the user has lost.

      • getPhrase

        public java.lang.String getPhrase()
        This get method returns the phrase to the user.
        Returns:
        phrase - the phrase that is guessed in the hangman game.

      • setMoviePhrase

        public void setMoviePhrase(int year)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        This set method setMoviePhrase gets one of the top ten movies from wikipedia from a specific year and makes it the phrase for the hangman game.
        Parameters:
        year - the year chosen for which the top films are picked
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setPhrase

        public void setPhrase(java.lang.String phraseToGuess)
        The set method setPhrase creates a new phrase for the game updating each respective field.
        Parameters:
        phraseToGuess - the phrase used in the game of hangman

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns a string with a separator, the phrase that is in the progress of being deciphered, and the state of the hangman.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String - a string representing the printed output of the game to the user.
